instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: I have 820-2838-a board with problem. when i press power button fan spin for second and stop after nothing happen. any idea? aha. i bought this laptop with faulty magsafe. when i got it there was no green light on charger. i replaced macsafe board and now i have green light

threads.title: 820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message:
The faulty magsafe maybe killed the charging circuit or the charger sense circuit.
What voltage do you get on ppbus_g3h?
Resistance between pins 17-18 and between pins 27-28 of U7000?

threads.title: 820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: i checked straight away that first and is ok :  ppbus_g3h -8.43v    resistance also good  pin 27-28: 20.5ohm    and 17-18:  3.1ohm

threads.title: 820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: Power good issue then I bet.  ALL_SYS_PWRGD coming high, if not find the rail that is missing.

threads.title: 820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: is this voltage should be show when computer is of? PP3V3_S3_FET  also i have missing  PP5V_S3_REG

threads.title: 820-2838-a problem with powering up. fan spin for 1 second and stop
threads.message: PP5V_S3 must come high if the fan spins.....
